bug.author: chentao
bug.summary: HDFS ACLs not synced when HDFS ACLs get changed
bug.description:
Alluxio Version: 2.0-preview and 2.0 master branch Describe the bug
when profile "hdfsAcl" is enabled ("hdfsActiveSync" disabled):
hadoop fs -mkdir /tmp/testacl hadoop fs -setfacl -m "user:tchen2:rwx" /tmp/testacl alluxio fs getfacl /tmp/testacl so far is OK. hadoop fs -setfacl -m "user:tchen3:rwx" /tmp/testacl alluxio fs getfacl /tmp/testacl the second ACL(user tchen3) is not showed, i guess not synced to alluxio.
when profile "hdfsActiveSync" is enabled ("hdfsAcl" disabled):
same steps as before, both the two ACLs is not showed with alluxio startSync executed, ACLs is not synced
when enable the two profiles, "ACL sync" is totally dismissed the two profiles "hdfsAcl" and "hdfsActiveSync" exclude each other's provider class:
To Reproduce as "Describe the bug" Expected behavior newly added ACLs to HDFS path is showed at alluxio getfacl command. Urgency Additional context alluxio: 1 master , 1 worker, HDFS cluster with 6 nodes alluxio-site.properties: <denchmark-code>alluxio.master.hostname=host123 alluxio.underfs.address=hdfs://ns1/ alluxio.worker.memory.size=32GB alluxio.underfs.hdfs.configuration=/etc/hadoop/conf.cloudera.hdfs/core-site.xml:/etc/hadoop/conf.cloudera.hdfs/hdfs-site.xml </denchmark-code>

comments.comment: Alluxio by default does not automatically sync file metadata from under file system, so the first case (hdfsAcl enabled and hdfsActiveSync disabled) is expected. When hdfsAcl profile is disabled, Alluxio will not attempt to retrieve ACL information from HDFS. The 3rd case sounds like a bug. <denchmark-link:https://github.com/yuzhu>@yuzhu</denchmark-link> Can you take a look?
